alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 10:16PM EST until January 04 at 11:31AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Alpharetta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand further into the woodlands and fields along the creek from near Cumming in south Forsyth County to Alpharetta and Roswell in north Fulton County. Additional portions of The Big Creek Greenway have minor flooding with 1 to 2 feet of water. Most of the walking and biking paths will be closed...especially upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 7.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.9 feet on 11/13/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
